slack.description: Slack MCP server for posting notifications, reading channels, and sending messages. Used by the notification skill for team communication. Set the environment variables above before use.

notes.setup: 1. Create a Slack App at https://api.slack.com/apps. 2. Add Bot Token Scopes: chat:write, channels:read, channels:history, groups:read. 3. Install the app to your workspace. 4. Set SLACK_BOT_TOKEN to the Bot User OAuth Token (xoxb-...). 5. Set SLACK_WORKSPACE to your workspace name. 6. Invite the bot to the channels it needs to post in.

tool_descriptions.post_message: Post a message to a Slack channel (write operation)
tool_descriptions.get_channels: List available channels the bot has access to (read)
tool_descriptions.get_messages: Read recent messages from a channel (read)

notes.level_1_permissions: At Autonomy Level 1: get_channels and get_messages only. No posting â€” agent drafts messages for human to send.
notes.level_2_permissions: At Autonomy Level 2: post_message enabled for configured default channels. No @here or @channel for routine messages.
notes.level_3_permissions: At Autonomy Level 3: All tools available. Can post to any channel the bot is in.
notes.level_4_permissions: At Autonomy Level 4: All tools fully autonomous. Can use @here for critical alerts.
